title: Trump’s Trade Gamble Will Continue, Despite Supreme Court Rebuke
summary: The president seems as intent on tariffs as ever and argues that his trade agenda is succeeding, despite little evidence to support it

title: Trump Looks Ahead to Summit With China’s Xi, but Tariffs and Taiwan Loom
summary: President Trump said his planned meeting with President Xi Jinping would be a grand display, but tensions over trade and defense could dampen the mood.

title: They Did Deals With Trump to Get Lower Tariffs. Now They Are Stuck.
summary: Countries that under the threat of tariffs made commitments like enormous investment pledges face the reality that they may have been better off waiting.

title: Shutdown at D.H.S. Extends to Cyber Agency, Adding to Setbacks
summary: The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency has navigated staffing cuts without a Senate-confirmed leader. Employees have become demoralized and concerned about the agency’s ability to ward off threats.

title: Inside Iran’s Preparations for War and Plans for Survival
summary: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has entrusted Ali Larijani, the top national security official, to ensure the Islamic Republic endures any military attacks and targeted killings.

title: How the Times Weather Team Tracks Big Storms: More Data, Less Hype
summary: When making forecasts, our reporters aim to visualize severe weather possibilities rather than focus on the most dire predictions. A possible blizzard this weekend is the latest test.

title: How The Times Made Its Tiny, Animated Olympic Athletes
summary: The Times’s tiny animated athletes flip, spin and soar through the air just like their real-life counterparts.

title: The Ex-Taxi Driver at the Center of Russia’s Shadow War
summary: The Kremlin’s sabotage campaign against European allies of Ukraine has been escalating. It needs people like Aleksei Kolosovsky, 42, to carry it out.

title: They Killed Their Abusers. Should They Spend Their Lives in Prison?
summary: A new law was supposed to help reduce the sentences of survivors of domestic violence. Most are still behind bars.

title: Historians Confirm: Tomorrow Won’t Be Better Than Today
summary: The human capacity for hope is an essential quality. But hope can also turn into delusion.

title: Ukraine Has Passed a Point of No Return
On an Ambitious Antarctic Quest, One Nation Is on the Sidelines
summary: None of the main research on the voyage of the Araon was funded by the U.S. National Science Foundation, a sign of the difficult times for American science.

title: Who Is Not Funding This Antarctic Expedition?
summary: Our climate reporter Raymond Zhong describes America’s shifting relationship with polar research amid the threat of rising sea levels.

title: At Least 15 Have Died on Tahoe-Area Slopes This Year
summary: Three more skiers have died in the Lake Tahoe area since the deadliest avalanche in California history on Tuesday killed nine.

title: Newsom, Targeting Red States, Kicks Off Book Tour in Nashville
summary: Scores of Californians have moved to Tennessee for its friendlier business environment and conservative politics. On Saturday, the Democratic governor accused of driving them away paid a visit.

title: New York Nurses’ Strike Ends After 6 Weeks as Last Holdouts Approve Deal
summary: Workers at NewYork-Presbyterian/Columbia hospital voted for a contract with raises and layoff protections, meaning more than 4,000 nurses will return.

title: The Queen Stuck by Prince Andrew. King Charles Is Pulling Away
summary: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, the former prince, is getting no help from the throne as the crisis over his ties to Jeffrey Epstein intensifies.
